data:
Hi there,
As you are a year ahead of me, could I get a little help finding housing for me for this next Fall term at OSU? I tried looking at Craigslist, but I can’t tell what’s good and what’s not!
I’m on a budget, so let’s keep it under $700 a month. And no roommate! If you can, find a place that doesn’t accept cats or dogs. Please send me links to the best place or two that you find!
Thank you ever so much, 
Myrcella

Hi Myrcella,

 

Sure I can help you find some places. Here are links to some places I liked that are under $700 a month and do not accept cats or dogs:

 

https://corvallis.craigslist.org/apa/5772867666.html

https://corvallis.craigslist.org/apa/5745802126.html

 

I hope you find these useful.

 

Good luck,

 

Elizabeth

 

From: Baratheon, Myrcella 
Sent: Tuesday, September 13, 2016 1:04 PM
To: Eveland, Elizabeth <Elizabeth.Eveland@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Housing... OMG!

 

Hi there,
As you are a year ahead of me, could I get a little help finding housing for me for this next Fall term at OSU? I tried looking at Craigslist, but I can’t tell what’s good and what’s not!
I’m on a budget, so let’s keep it under $700 a month. And no roommate! If you can, find a place that doesn’t accept cats or dogs. Please send me links to the best place or two that you find!
Thank you ever so much, 
Myrcella

Hi Eve,

 

Thanks! That one on 3rd street in downtown looks nice. I can walk to shops and restaurants.

 

Myr

Elizabeth

Subject:  Housing... OMG!

 

Hi there,
As you are a year ahead of me, could I get a little help finding housing for me for this next Fall term at OSU? I tried looking at Craigslist, but I can’t tell what’s good and what’s not!
I’m on a budget, so let’s keep it under $700 a month. And no roommate! If you can, find a place that doesn’t accept cats or dogs. Please send me links to the best place or two that you find!
Thank you ever so much, 
Myrcella

Hi!

 

There’s a picnic in the woods near Alsea that we’re supposed to go to this weekend. We may also hike to the waterfall. Can you please check the weather and let me know what I should wear and if I should bring sunscreen?

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

Hi,

 

It looks like weather in Alsea this weekend would range from 23 C to 12 C with some evening showers. However, days could be sunny, so bring your sunscreen. For hiking at the waterfall, I would suggest bring sportswear. I would also recommend getting a rain jacket for evenings. 

 

Enjoy,

 

Elizabeth

From: Baratheon, Myrcella 
Sent: Tuesday, September 13, 2016 1:13 PM
To: Eveland, Elizabeth <Elizabeth.Eveland@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Weather?

 

 

Hi!

 

There’s a picnic in the woods near Alsea that we’re supposed to go to this weekend. We may also hike to the waterfall. Can you please check the weather and let me know what I should wear and if I should bring sunscreen?

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

Thanks, Eve. I can never check the weather myself… just so depressing most of the time! I’ll bring my fancy new rain jacket… should be a hit in the evening! 

 

Myr

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

Hello Eve,

 

I am planning an event at my sorority this weekend and I could use some ideas for food to make as appetizers. I am expecting to have 20 people at the event and would like to include options for those who are vegetarian or gluten free. I will have about an hour to make these ahead of time so please keep that in mind as you research. It’s really important that people love the event, so try and pick some recipes that people will rave about!

 

Please email me three or four recipes that I can consider for appetizers.  

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

Hi,

I am sending you three appetizer recipes that include vegetarian as well as gluten free options. You can also prepare these within 1 hour. I hope you like these.

Veggie Delight on Garlic Bread (Vegetarian)

*  Prep- 20 m 

*  Cook- 5 m 

*  Ready In- 30 m

You would need:

*	1/8 cup olive oil 
*	1 clove garlic, chopped 
*	1 medium eggplant, cubed 
*	1 zucchini, cubed 
*	1 medium tomato - peeled, seeded and chopped 
*	1 teaspoon salt 

*	2 teaspoons minced fresh oregano 
*	2 teaspoons minced fresh basil (optional) 
*	1 French baguette 
*	4 teaspoons garlic powder 
*	6 teaspoons butter, softened 

Directions:

1.	Place olive oil and garlic in a large skillet. Fry (stirring occasionally) over a medium heat until the garlic is golden brown; approximately 2 minutes.
2.	Add eggplant and zucchini to the skillet, fry until the eggplant is brown and tender; approximately 5 to 7 minutes.
3.	Add the tomato chunks to the skillet, stir the mixture until the tomato becomes a pulp. Mix in salt, oregano, and basil. Stir the entire mixture over the heat for 2 minutes, then remove pan from heat and let the mixture cool.
4.	Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
5.	Slice the bread into 12 (1-inch thick) slices. Distribute garlic powder and butter evenly over the top of each slice. Place the slices directly onto the oven rack (do not use a cookie sheet, the bread will get crisper this way). Let the bread heat for 3 to 5 minutes.
6.	Remove the bread from the oven and arrange them on a serving platter. Spread the vegetable mixture over the 12 bread slices, distribute the topping as evenly as you can. Serve immediately.


My Crab Cakes


*	2 tablespoons olive oil 
*	6 green onions, chopped 
*	3/8 cup olive oil 
*	1 (16 ounce) can canned crabmeat, drained 
*	1 egg 
*	1 tablespoon mayonnaise 
*	1 teaspoon dry mustard 

*	8 ounces buttery round crackers, crushed 
*	1/2 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper 
*	1 teaspoon garlic powder 
*	1/4 teaspoon Old Bay Seasoning TM 
*	salt to taste 
*	ground black pepper to taste 
*	1 cup panko (Japanese bread crumbs) or regular dry bread crumbs 
*	Add all ingredients to list 


Directions 


*         Prep-20 m 

*         Cook-10 m 

*         Ready In-30 m 

1.	Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a skillet over high heat. Saute green onions briefly until tender; cool slightly.
2.	Combine crabmeat, sauteed green onions, egg, mayonnaise, dry mustard, crushed crackers, cayenne pepper, garlic powder, Old Bay seasoning, salt and pepper. Form into 1/2 inch thick patties. Coat the patties with bread crumbs.
3.	Heat 1/2 cup oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Cook cakes until golden brown on each side. Drain briefly on paper towels and serve hot.

 


Easy Guacamole (Gluten-free)


 


Ingredients


*	2 avocados 
*	1 small onion, finely chopped 
*	1 clove garlic, minced 

*	1 ripe tomato, chopped 
*	1 lime, juiced 
*	salt and pepper to taste 


Directions 


*         Prep- 10 m 

*         Ready In- 40 m 

1.	Peel and mash avocados in a medium serving bowl. Stir in onion, garlic, tomato, lime juice, salt and pepper. Season with remaining lime juice and salt and pepper to taste. Chill for half an hour to blend flavors.

 

Eve

 

 

From: Baratheon, Myrcella 
Sent: Tuesday, September 13, 2016 1:23 PM
To: Eveland, Elizabeth <Elizabeth.Eveland@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Awesome recipes

 

 

Hello Eve,

 

I am planning an event at my sorority this weekend and I could use some ideas for food to make as appetizers. I am expecting to have 20 people at the event and would like to include options for those who are vegetarian or gluten free. I will have about an hour to make these ahead of time so please keep that in mind as you research. It’s really important that people love the event, so try and pick some recipes that people will rave about!

 

Please email me three or four recipes that I can consider for appetizers.  

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

These look great, Eve. Good appeal to a lot of people and nothing too strange that the sisters won’t want to try! Thanks for these thoughtful selections!

 

Myr

Ingredients


*	2 avocados

*	1 clove garlic, minced 

*	1 ripe tomato, chopped 
*	1 lime, juiced 
*	salt and pepper to taste 


Directions 


*        Prep- 10 m 

*        Ready In- 40 m

Eve

Hello Eve,

 

Just a friendly reminder that I’ll need the following two books soon and you promised to help me buy them for a good price! :)

 

Please find them wherever you can, just make sure you will receive them by next week for classes. My budget is at most 200 dollars to get these two textbooks, but please please please try and find the best available prices.

 

Textbooks Needed:

Engineering Economic Analysis by Donald Newnan 12th edition IBSN: 978-0199339273

 

Robert Love, Linux Kernel Development 3/e, Addison-Wesley, 2010, ISBN: 978-1-672-32946-3

 

Email me back with where to buy them for the best price so they’ll arrive next week! I owe you lunch for this big help!

 

Thanks! :) :) :)

Myrcella

Hi,

 

You can get both these books from amazon for under $200 and they will arrive within 3-4 days of ordering.

 

https://www.amazon.com/Engineering-Economic-Analysis-Donald-Newnan/dp/0199339279/ref=sr_1_fkmr0_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1473799962&sr=8-1-fkmr0&keywords=Engineering+Economic+Analysis+by+Donald+Newnan+12th+edition+IBSN%3A+978-0199339273

 

https://www.amazon.com/Linux-Kernel-Development-Robert-Love/dp/0672329468/ref=sr_1_fkmr0_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1473799837&sr=8-1-fkmr0&keywords=Robert+Love%2C+Linux+Kernel+Development+3%2Fe%2C+Addison-Wesley%2C+2010%2C+ISBN%3A+978-1-672-32946-3

 

Hope this helps.

 

Good luck,

 

Eve

Hi, Elizabeth ,

 

Game of Thrones season six is over and I really need something new to watch! I just don’t know what would be good. 

 

I’m a big fan of action dramas such as House of Cards and Homeland (all of which I’ve already seen, unfortunately). 

 

What’s the next best show after these three? I don’t want to be fooled into watching something bad, so please see if the critics agree that the show is really excellent. Some rankings would also help give me confidence the show will be worthwhile.

 

Thank you so much! 


Melisandre

Hi,

 

I would recommend you to watch Arrow. It is about a spoiled billionaire playboy Oliver Queen who is missing and presumed dead when his yacht is lost at sea. He returns five years later a changed man, determined to clean up the city as a hooded vigilante armed with a bow. It is been rated 7.9/10 by imdb. You can check out the ratings stat here http://www.imdb.com/title/tt2193021/ratings?ref_=tt_ov_rt

 

I hope you enjoy the show.

 

Elizabeth

Thanks, Eve.

 

Melisandre

Hi there!

 

I need to buy a gift for a friend.

 

My friend loves the outdoors and the color pink.

She’s 22 years old and her birthday is in a week (7 days).

I will need something that will get here on time.

Nothing that will take too long to ship please.

 

I have 30 dollars to spend on my friend.

Please spend as close to that as you can.

 

Please email me the link(s) to the gift(s) you find and include how much they cost.

 

Thank you,

Melisandre

Hi,

 

Here are some options for your friend’s birthday gift.

I hope you like these.

 

Elizabeth

Hi there,
 
I heard from a friend that you are the one to talk to about this subject.
 
Unfortunately, my friend has to take two strong medications together - Adderall, and Valium. Are there any issues (contraindications) with taking them both together? Is there anything (food, activities, etc.) that he needs to avoid? I just want him to be safe. Please send a list of what you find, along with links to your resources.
 
Thanks for volunteering to check it out!
 
Davos

Hello,

They counteract each other to some extent. Valium is a benzodiazepine anxiolytic and relaxant, whereas Adderall is a stimulant.

Do not use Adderall if you have taken an MAO inhibitor in the past 14 days. A dangerous drug interaction could occur. MAO inhibitors include isocarboxazid, linezolid, methylene blue injection, phenelzine, rasagiline, selegiline, tranylcypromine, and others. This medication may impair your thinking or reactions. Be careful if you drive or do anything that requires you to be alert.Avoid drinking fruit juices or taking vitamin C at the same time you take Adderall. These can make your body absorb less of the medicine.

Valium may impair thinking or reactions. Be careful if you drive or do anything that requires you to be alert. 

Souces: Drugs.com

Elizabeth

 

From: Davos Stark [mailto:davos.stark@oregonstate.edu] 
Sent: Tuesday, September 13, 2016 3:53 PM
To: Eveland, Elizabeth <Elizabeth.Eveland@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  check on medication

 

Hi there,

 

I heard from a friend that you are the one to talk to about this subject.

 

Unfortunately, my friend has to take two strong medications together - Adderall, and Valium. Are there any issues (contraindications) with taking them both together? On 09/13/2016 04:01 PM, Eveland, Elizabeth wrote:


	Hello,

	They counteract each other to some extent. Valium is a benzodiazepine anxiolytic and relaxant, whereas Adderall is a stimulant.

	Do not use Adderall if you have taken an MAO inhibitor in the past 14 days. A dangerous drug interaction could occur. MAO inhibitors include isocarboxazid, linezolid, methylene blue injection, phenelzine, rasagiline, selegiline, tranylcypromine, and others. This medication may impair your thinking or reactions. Be careful if you drive or do anything that requires you to be alert.Avoid drinking fruit juices or taking vitamin C at the same time you take Adderall. These can make your body absorb less of the medicine.

	Valium may impair thinking or reactions. Be careful if you drive or do anything that requires you to be alert. 

	Souces: Drugs.com

	Elizabeth

Greetings, traveler,
 
I hear you’re are interested in exploring Eastern Europe with our group. Recently the group is wondering whether or not it is safe to travel right now. We need to do some research and see what we can find out.
 
The plan is to land in Istanbul. Next, we will be traveling to Sofia, the capital of Bulgaria.  After Sofia, the next step is some car travel to Macedonia and then onwards to Albania. Our last stop will be Tirana, in Albania.
 
The group would like to have some information sent to me to start this travel planning out:
 
A quick overview of each country’s political climate - I don’t want anyone getting into trouble and having this turn into some geopolitical affair! Is the country at war with a US ally? Is the country in political turmoil? Is there a US embassy? Is it safe to travel there now?
 
This will be a good start for the travel planning. Please research these items and send the information to me right away.
 
Kind regards,
Davos Stark
Eastern Reaches, an OSU Travel Group
